passages.text:
You're in a small office, there is a door to your left and a window in front of you. A desk sits below the window piled high with paperwork.
Do you [[explore the desk]], try to [[climb out the window]], or attempt to [[escape through the door]]?
passages.name: In the office

passages.text:
While rummaging through the paperwork that's piled on the desk you find a room key. The key is a perfect fit for the door, you unlock it and step out into a small corridor.
Do you [[turn left|deadend]] or [[right|first floor]]?
passages.name: explore the desk

passages.text: You clamber on top of the desk and climb out of the window expecting your feet to land on the terrace. But there is nothing there, and you're falling.
passages.name: climb out the window

passages.text: You pull on the handle but the door is locked. Your only options are to [[explore the desk]] or [[climb out the window]].
passages.name: escape through the door

passages.text:
The doors to the elevator open. You step inside and look at buttons on the panel.
[[press second floor|second floor]].
[[reception]].
[[basement]].
Which button do you press?
passages.name: first floor lift

passages.text: You walk over to the staircase, the coast seems clear. Do you [[go up|second floor]] or do you go [[down|reception]] the stairs?
passages.name: first floor staircase

passages.text:
The smell of damp hits you straight away as you step into the basement. You look around but there is no exit, you're only option is to go back up.
Do you [[take the elevator|basement lift]]? or do you [[take the stairs|basement staircase]]?
passages.name: basement

passages.text:
You arrive in the reception, the lights are off and there is no one behind the counter. You walk over to the main entrance and try the door, it's locked.
As you turn around to head back something jumps out from behind the reception desk, you've been caught.
passages.name: reception

passages.text:
You're on an empty roof terrace, there is no way out except for back down.
Do you [[take the stairs|first floor]] or do you take the [[elevator|second floor lift]]?
passages.name: second floor

passages.text:
You're in a small opening at the end of a door lined corridor.
There is staircase to your left and an elevator to your right. Do you [[take the stairs|first floor staircase]], take the [[elevator|first floor lift]], or [[walk down the corridor|deadend]]?
passages.name: first floor

passages.text:
As you rush down the corridor you hear footsteps following you. You pick up pace but hit a deadend.
You can not turn back.
Game-over.
passages.name: deadend

passages.text:
You call the elevator and wait in the dark for it to arrive. Straight away as the doors slide open you dive inside. You look at buttons on the panel.
[[press second floor|second floor]].
[[first floor]].
[[reception]].
Which button do you press?
passages.name: basement lift

passages.text:
You're almost at the top of the staircase when you notice a flickering light coming from an alcove.
You stop in your tracks unsure of whether to [[turn around|basement]] or [[carry on]] towards the light.
passages.name: basement staircase

passages.text:
You step into the elevator, glad to be out of the cold nights air.
You look at buttons on the panel.
[[press first floor|first floor]].
[[reception]].
[[basement]].
Which button do you press?
passages.name: second floor lift

passages.text:
You reach the alcove and discover the flickering light is from an exit sign above a door.
You push the door open, stumbling out onto the pavement.
Congratulations you've escaped the office.
passages.name: carry on
